a114-1.resolution: wq-484 completed in s1282. directive-outcome.js updated to exclude scoped directives from wrong session types. Post-fix B session s1284 received urgentDirectives=[] (d049 correctly excluded).

a114-1.metric_after: B session s1284: 0 directives assigned (correct — d049 excluded). Only 1 post-fix B session available for measurement.
a114-1.note: Fix effective. B sessions no longer assigned E-session-only directives.

a114-2.resolution: B session avg cost decreased from $2.47 to $2.41 in this audit cycle. wq-485 (B session cost trend monitor) completed in s1284. No sessions over $3.00 threshold in recent window (s1279: $1.77, s1282: $2.49, s1284: $1.65). Trend reversed.
a114-2.note: Cost trend stabilized. Monitor hook now in place for ongoing detection.

d049_compliance.note: Stable at 100% for 11th consecutive audit. 5/5 checked E sessions compliant (s1283:7, s1278:7, s1273:4, s1268:3, s1258:4). Average 5.0 intel entries/session — highest ever.

d049_compliance.trend: STABLE at 100% for 11th consecutive audit. Average 5.0 entries per session (up from 3.6).

intel_volume.note: Intel volume increased. s1283 and s1278 each produced 7 entries.

brainstorming.verdict: DEPLETED — 0 active fresh ideas. 4 observations remain but no evolution ideas. All 5 ideas from wq-457 replenishment (s1257) consumed or auto-retired. 5 ideas from R#223 (s1280) also consumed/retired. Pipeline needs replenishment again.

Only s1280 is post-fix. Pre-fix R sessions (s1265, s1270, s1275) had empty urgentDirectives — resolved via wq-477.

R.verdict: EFFECTIVE — R#222 caused heartbeat crash but auto-restore recovered. Directive maintenance 100%.

stale_references.deleted_files_last_60_days: 10 flagged by git diff-filter, but most are false positives — files removed from git tracking but still exist on disk (BRIEFING.md, directives.json, ctxly.json all present).

heartbeat_crash.cause: R#222 (s1270) extracted periodic checks from heartbeat.sh. Introduced syntax error that caused 'rotation-state:: command not found' on line 64.
heartbeat_crash.impact: 70 session counter increments burned (s1285-s1354). No sessions ran. No data lost — just counter inflation.
heartbeat_crash.resolution: Auto-restore from known-good backup. Current heartbeat.sh is functional.
heartbeat_crash.prevention_needed: heartbeat.sh needs syntax validation before commit (bash -n check in pre-commit hook)

infrastructure.verdict: FUNCTIONAL — heartbeat crash was significant but auto-restored. 83/83 hooks pass syntax.

d045.note: Pre-commit hook prevents future leaks. wq-255 in-progress. No new exposure detected. Sessions_since continues to grow but blocker is external.

security.verdict: CLEAN — d045 externally blocked, no new issues

cost.trend: STABLE — $1.83 avg (down from $1.85 in A#114). B session avg decreased from $2.47 to $2.41. All types within budget caps.
cost.note: 70 crashed sessions (s1285-s1354) had zero cost — they never reached Claude API.

critical_issues: heartbeat.sh crash from R#222 burned 70 session counter increments (s1285-s1354). Auto-restore recovered but root cause needs fix: bash -n validation should gate heartbeat.sh commits.

recommended_actions.description: R#222 (s1270) introduced a syntax error in heartbeat.sh that crashed the heartbeat loop for ~70 iterations. The auto-restore recovered operations, but there is no pre-commit validation for heartbeat.sh syntax. A `bash -n heartbeat.sh` check in the pre-commit hook would prevent this class of failure.
recommended_actions.action: Add bash -n syntax validation for heartbeat.sh to the pre-commit hook. This is a one-line addition that prevents the most impactful single-point-of-failure in the system.

recommended_actions.description: Brainstorming pipeline depleted again — 0 active fresh ideas. This is the 3rd time in recent audits (A#109 flagged it, wq-457 replenished, A#110 confirmed fix, now depleted again). Ideas are consumed faster than they're generated. R sessions need a stronger replenishment mandate.
recommended_actions.action: R session should replenish brainstorming pipeline when active fresh ideas < 3. Create wq item for next R session.

recommended_actions.description: Work queue critically low — only 1 pending item (wq-481) and 2 blocked items. After next B session consumes wq-481, queue will be empty. This forces B sessions to either skip work or replenish mid-session, reducing efficiency.
recommended_actions.action: R session should replenish work queue with 3-5 items from brainstorming, intel, or directive decomposition.
